question.text:
Match List I and List II and select the correct answer with the help of the codes given below the lists
 
List I List II
A. Somatotropin 1. Neurohypophysis
B. Oxytocin 2. Cretinism
C. Thyroxine 3. Rickets
D. Vitamin D 4. Gigantism

solution.text: Somatotropin is growth hormone and gigantism is medical condition in which there is abnormal growth. Posterior part of pituitary is called as neurohypophysis. Neurohypophysis is structural foundation of neurohumoral system coordinating fluid balance and reproductive function. Parturition and lactation is done by oxytocin. Cretinism is seen in newborns. Cretinism is a condition due to deficiency of thyroid hormones. There are 2 types of thyroid hormones  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  Triiodothyronine and  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  Thyroxine. Vitamin D is a fat soluble vitamin. Rickets is a condition found in children's in which there is softening of bones due to deficiency of vitamin D.
